Package pl.lib.api

Class ReportBuilder

java.lang.Object
pl.lib.api.ReportBuilder
public class ReportBuilder extends Object
Fluent builder that programmatically constructs a JasperReports design (JasperDesign) and compiles it into a JasperReport. Responsibilities: - Manage columns, styles, groups, subreports, parameters and variables - Configure page settings, margins, bands (title, column header, detail, footer, summary) - Apply visual themes and conditional formatting rules (zebra stripes, highlight rules) - Distribute automatic column widths and generate bookmarks Usage pattern: 1) Create a builder, configure it fluently, add columns/groups/styles/subreports 2) Optionally call preparePageAndGetColumnWidth() to know the usable width 3) Call build() to compile the design to a JasperReport Thread-safety: not thread-safe. Create a new instance per report. Reuse: the builder keeps internal state; prefer creating a fresh builder for each report.

  • Constructor Details

    • ReportBuilder

      public ReportBuilder()
      Creates a builder with a random report name. Equivalent to ReportBuilder(String) with a generated UUID.

    • ReportBuilder

      public ReportBuilder(String reportName)
      Creates a builder with the provided report name. Effects: - Initializes an empty JasperDesign with the given name - Sets language to "java" and WhenNoData to WhenNoDataTypeEnum.ALL_SECTIONS_NO_DETAIL
      Parameters:
      reportName - logical name of the report; used as the JasperDesign name

  • Method Details

    • withPageFormat

      public ReportBuilder withPageFormat(String format)
      Sets the target page format (case-insensitive) among: A4 (default), A3, LETTER, LEGAL. The actual page width/height are applied during internal page setup (e.g. in build() or preparePageAndGetColumnWidth()). Note: Orientation and margins also affect the final column width.
      Parameters:
      format - page format name, e.g. "A4", "A3", "LETTER", "LEGAL"; null/blank is ignored
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • withColumnWidth

      public ReportBuilder withColumnWidth(int width)
      Explicitly sets the JasperDesign column width in pixels. Important: this value can be recalculated/overridden by the internal page setup performed by setupPage() which is executed by build() and preparePageAndGetColumnWidth(). To ensure a custom column width persists, call this after page setup or adjust margins/page format accordingly.
      Parameters:
      width - column width (pixels)
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • withColorSettings

      public ReportBuilder withColorSettings(ColorSettings settings)
      Supplies color customization used by themes and bands (e.g. title background/foreground, column header colors, borders, detail colors, group header colors).
      Parameters:
      settings - collection of color-related preferences; if null nothing changes
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • preparePageAndGetColumnWidth

      public int preparePageAndGetColumnWidth()
      Applies page format, orientation and margins, then returns the current usable column width. Useful before laying out columns with negative (auto) widths.
      Returns:
      computed column width (pageWidth - leftMargin - rightMargin)

    • withTitle

      public ReportBuilder withTitle(String title)
      Sets the report title parameter ("ReportTitle") used in the title band.
      Parameters:
      title - human-readable report title
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • withHorizontalLayout

      public ReportBuilder withHorizontalLayout(boolean isLandscape)
      Sets page orientation.
      Parameters:
      isLandscape - true for landscape, false for portrait
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • withMargins

      public ReportBuilder withMargins(int top, int right, int bottom, int left)
      Sets page margins.
      Parameters:
      top - top margin in pixels
      right - right margin in pixels
      bottom - bottom margin in pixels
      left - left margin in pixels
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • withCompanyInfo

      public ReportBuilder withCompanyInfo(CompanyInfo companyInfo)
      Optionally provides company info. Currently a placeholder/no-op reserved for future use. Typical data could include company name, address, tax id etc.
      Parameters:
      companyInfo - company details; ignored for now
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • withTitleBand

      public ReportBuilder withTitleBand(boolean enabled)
      Enables or disables the title band.
      Parameters:
      enabled - true to render the title band; false to omit it
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • withPageFooter

      public ReportBuilder withPageFooter(boolean enabled)
      Enables or disables the page footer band, which contains the left text and page number.
      Parameters:
      enabled - true to render page footer; false to omit it
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • withFormattingOptions

      public ReportBuilder withFormattingOptions(FormattingOptions options)
      Sets formatting options controlling conditional highlighting, zebra striping, and bookmark generation.
      Parameters:
      options - formatting options; if null, defaults are kept
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • withSummaryBand

      public ReportBuilder withSummaryBand(boolean enabled)
      Enables or disables the summary band. When enabled, the band can display report-level aggregations for numeric columns (e.g., SUM). Visibility can also be controlled at runtime via the "SHOW_SUMMARY" parameter.
      Parameters:
      enabled - true to add a summary band; false to omit it
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • getParameters

      public Map<String,Object> getParameters()
      Provides access to the internal parameter map that will be added to the design (e.g., ReportTitle, CompanyName, FooterLeftText, SHOW_SUMMARY, subreport handles). You can add your own custom parameters here before build().
      Returns:
      mutable map of parameter name to value

    • addColumn

      public ReportBuilder addColumn(Column column)
      Adds a column definition to the report. Column width semantics: - width > 0: fixed width in pixels - width == 0: hidden column - width < 0: auto-width; will be distributed evenly among all auto columns after accounting for fixed-width columns (see calculateColumnWidths()).
      Parameters:
      column - column configuration (title, field, type, style, width, pattern)
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • addGroup

      public ReportBuilder addGroup(Group group)
      Adds a grouping definition. Groups may render a group header/footer and support per-group aggregations when paired with column calculations.
      Parameters:
      group - grouping configuration (field, style, visibility, header expression)
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • addStyle

      public ReportBuilder addStyle(Style style)
      Adds a style if a style with the same name is not already present. Styles are injected into the JasperDesign during build.
      Parameters:
      style - style definition (font, size, bold, colors, alignment, borders, padding)
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • addSubreport

      public ReportBuilder addSubreport(Subreport subreport)
      Registers a subreport to be rendered in the detail section. For each subreport a JasperReport parameter named "SUBREPORT_" is declared and the subreport receives a dedicated dataSource taken from the corresponding field in the master dataset.
      Parameters:
      subreport - subreport metadata (data field, summary visibility)
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • build

      public net.sf.jasperreports.engine.JasperReport build() throws net.sf.jasperreports.engine.JRException
      Builds the design and compiles it into a JasperReport. Steps performed in order: 1) Declare required parameters 2) Setup page size/orientation/margins and compute column width 3) Distribute auto column widths 4) Inject styles (including themes and conditional styles) 5) Declare fields (for columns, groups and subreports) 6) Build groups and declare per-group variables 7) Create title, column header, detail, page footer and (optional) summary bands 8) Compile the design
      Returns:
      compiled JasperReport ready to be filled
      Throws:
      net.sf.jasperreports.engine.JRException - if the design is invalid or compilation fails

    • calculateColumnWidths

      public void calculateColumnWidths()
      Recalculates negative (auto) column widths so that their total fills the remaining space after subtracting fixed-width columns from the available column width. Columns with width == 0 remain hidden. Non-negative widths are preserved.

    • withTheme

      public ReportBuilder withTheme(ReportTheme theme)
      Applies a visual theme to the report by adding predefined styles. This method clears any existing styles and replaces them with theme-specific styles from the ThemeFactory.
      Parameters:
      theme - The visual theme to apply (DEFAULT, CLASSIC, MODERN, CORPORATE, MINIMAL)
      Returns:
      this ReportBuilder instance for method chaining

    • getDesign

      public net.sf.jasperreports.engine.design.JasperDesign getDesign()
      Exposes the underlying JasperDesign for advanced customizations prior to build. Note that changing the design directly may interact with builder-managed state. Prefer using builder methods when available.
      Returns:
      the live JasperDesign instance used by this builder
